meanings.definition: The position or office of a judge.
meanings.sent1: Her dream was to attain a judgeship and serve justice.
meanings.sent2: The judgeships in the courthouse were all filled with experienced individuals.
meanings.sent3: The judgeships in the town were so sought after that even the mayor wanted one!
meanings.sent4: In the realm of law, judgeships were the crowns worn by those who upheld justice.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of a judgeship weighed heavily on her shoulders.

meanings.sent1: The judgeships gathered for a meeting to discuss legal matters.
meanings.sent2: Respect for the judgeships in the courtroom was evident in the silence that followed their entrance.
meanings.sent3: The judgeships were like a close-knit family, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of legal proceedings, the judgeships stood as beacons of fairness.
meanings.sent5: The unity among the judgeships made the legal system stronger.
